newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China executes two HK men for stealing trucks.
newsitem.headline: China executes two HK men for stealing trucks.

text.p: China has executed two Hong Kong men for stealing trucks in the southern city of Shenzhen adjoining the territory, a newspaper said on Thursday.
The Shenzhen court handed death sentences to Ho So-tai and Siu Chi-wah, both 30, on Wednesday, and they were executed immediately, the Chinese-language Tin Tin Daily News said.

They had stolen three trucks worth a total of one million yuan (US$120,500) along with goods on the vehicles in 1992, the newspaper said. It did not make clear why the case had taken so long to reach sentencing.

The trucks plied between China's Guangdong province and Hong Kong, which returns to Chinese rule on July 1. There has been a spate of thefts on trucks using this route in recent years, the newspaper said.
According to Amnesty International, China executed more than 3,500 people in 1996, more than all other countries combined.
